isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the left and right countershaft assemblies are identical and disassembled in the same manner.

step1.para: Remove the drive gear retaining snap ring from the front of each countershaft ( Figure 116).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use the rear face of the 3rd speed gear as a base and press the drive gear, PTO gear, and 3rd speed gear from each countershaft ( Figure 117). This removes the front bearing inner race from the countershaft.

figure.caption: Figure 117. Press Drive Gear, PTO Gear and 3rd Speed Gear From Each Countershaft

caution.para: NEVER USE THE PTO GEAR AS A PRESSING BASE. The narrow face width of this gear makes it very susceptible to breakage.

step1.para: Disassembly is complete at this point due to the welded countershaft design ( Figure 118). Replacement of , low first and 2nd speed gears will be completed as an assembly. Gears are not available separately.

figure.caption: Figure 118. Disassembly Complete at This Point Due to Welded Countershaft Design
